description: Primes the sum of two, three and four consecutive composite numbers.
links: Klaus Brockhaus, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000. [From _Klaus Brockhaus_, Jun 17 2009]
mathematica: composite[ n_Integer ] := (k = n + PrimePi[ n ] + 1; While[ k - PrimePi[ k ] - 1 != n, k++ ]; k); a = b = c = {}; Do[ p = Sum[ composite[ n + m ], {m, 0, 1} ]; If[ PrimeQ[ p ], a = Append[ a, p ] ]; p = Sum[ composite[ n + m ], {m, 0, 2} ]; If[ PrimeQ[ p ], b = Append[ b, p ] ]; p = Sum[ composite[ n + m ], {m, 0, 3} ]; If[ PrimeQ[ p ], c = Append[ c, p ] ], {n, 1, 25000} ]; Intersection[ a, b, c ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 30 2001
